intro: Peucedanum microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, characteristic of the carrot family. Peucedanum microphyllum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
